wadl:doc.p: Create a bug (with an appropriate bugtask) and return it.

tr.td: The Product, Distribution or DistributionSourcePackage affected by this bug.

wadl:doc.p: Things to note when using this factory:

ul.li: the owner will be subscribed to the bug
distribution, product and package contacts (whichever ones are applicable based on the bug report target) will bug subscribed to all public bugs only
for public upstreams bugs where there is no upstream bug contact, the product owner will be subscribed instead

wadl:param.name: ws.op
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The name of the operation being invoked.

wadl:param.name: security_related
wadl:param.wadl:doc: This bug is a security vulnerability

wadl:param.name: target
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The project, distribution or source package that has this bug.

wadl:doc.p: Tags
Separated by whitespace.
Summary
A one-line summary of the problem.
This bug report should be private
Private bug reports are visible only to their subscribers.
Description

dl.dt: A detailed description of the problem,
dl.dd: including the steps required to reproduce it.

wadl:doc.p: Return all non-merged Persons with at least one email address whose name, displayname or email address match <text>.
If text is an empty string, all persons with at least one email address will be returned.

<orderBy> can be either a string with the column name you want to sort or a list of column names as strings. If no orderBy is specified the results will be ordered using the default ordering specified in Person._defaultOrder.
If exclude_inactive_accounts is True, any accounts whose account_status is any of INACTIVE_ACCOUNT_STATUSES will not be in the returned set.
If must_have_email is True, only people with one or more email addresses are returned.
While we don't have Full Text Indexes in the emailaddress table, we'll be trying to match the text only against the beginning of an email address.

wadl:param.name: ws.op
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The name of the operation being invoked.

wadl:doc.p: Display Name
Your name as you would like it displayed throughout Launchpad. Most people use their full name here.
Name
A short unique name, beginning with a lower-case letter or number, and containing only letters, numbers, dots, hyphens, or plus signs.
Subscription period
Number of days a new subscription lasts before expiring. You can customize the length of an individual subscription when approving it. Leave this empty or set to 0 for subscriptions to never expire.
Team Description
Use plain text; URLs will be linkified
Renewal period
Number of days a subscription lasts after being renewed. You can customize the lengths of individual renewals, but this is what's used for auto-renewed and user-renewed memberships.
Return the person with the given email address.
Return None if there is no person with the given email address.

wadl:param.name: ws.op
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The name of the operation being invoked.

<orderBy> can be either a string with the column name you want to sort or a list of column names as strings. If no orderBy is specified the results will be ordered using the default ordering specified in Person._defaultOrder.
While we don't have Full Text Indexes in the emailaddress table, we'll be trying to match the text only against the beginning of an email address.

wadl:doc.p: Create and return a brand new Product.
See IProduct for a description of the parameters.

wadl:param.wadl:doc: The name of the operation being invoked.

wadl:doc.p: Wiki URL

dl.dt: The full URL of this project's wiki, if it has
dl.dd: one. Please include the http://

wadl:doc.p: Download URL

dl.dt: The full URL where downloads for this project
dl.dd: are located, if available. Please include the http://

wadl:doc.p: License reviewed
Whether or not this project's license has been reviewed. Editable only by reviewers (Admins & Commercial Admins).
Display Name

dl.dt: The name of the project as it would appear in a
dl.dd: paragraph.

wadl:doc.p: Description

dl.dt: Include information on how to get involved with
dl.dd: development. Don't repeat anything from the Summary.

wadl:doc.p: Title
The project title. Should be just a few words.
Summary
The summary should be a single short paragraph.
Part of

Super-project. In Launchpad, we can setup a special "project group" that is an overarching initiative that includes several related projects. For example, the Mozilla Project produces Firefox, Thunderbird and Gecko. This information is used to group those projects in a coherent way. If you make this project part of a group, the group preferences and decisions around bug tracking, translation and security policy will apply to this project.
Freshmeat Project

dl.dt: The Freshmeat project name for
dl.dd: this project, if it is in freshmeat.

wadl:doc.p: Sourceforge Project

dl.dt: The SourceForge project name for
dl.dd: this project, if it is in sourceforge.

wadl:doc.p: Programming Languages

dl.dt: A comma delimited list of programming
dl.dd: languages used for this project.

wadl:doc.p: Screenshots URL

dl.dt: The full URL for screenshots of this project,
dl.dd: if available. Please include the http://

wadl:doc.p: Description of additional licenses
Description of licenses that do not appear in the list above.
Homepage URL

dl.dt: The project home page. Please include
dl.dd: the http://

wadl:doc.p: Registrant
This person registered the project in Launchpad.
Name
At least one lowercase letter or number, followed by letters, dots, hyphens or plusses. Keep this name short, as it is used in URLs.

wadl:doc.p: Return the latest projects registered in Launchpad.

If the quantity is not specified or is a value that is not 'None' then the set of projects returned is limited to that value (the default quantity is 5). If quantity is 'None' then all projects are returned. For the web service it is not possible to specify the quantity, so all projects are returned, latest first.

wadl:doc.p: Return a dictionary containing the build counters for an archive.
This is necessary currently because the IArchive.failed_builds etc. counters are not in use.
The returned dictionary contains the follwoing keys and values:

ul.li: 'pending': number of builds in BUILDING or NEEDSBUILD state;
'failed': number of builds in FAILEDTOBUILD, MANUALDEPWAIT, CHROOTWAIT and FAILEDTOUPLOAD state;

tr.td: Indicates whether to include builds with the status NEEDSBUILD in the pending and total counts. This is useful in situations where a build that hasn't started isn't considered a build by the user.
a dictionary with the 4 keys specified above.
dict.

wadl:doc.p: All ISourcePackagePublishingHistory target to this archive.

version: source version filter (always exact match).

distroseries: IDistroSeries filter.
pocket: PackagePublishingPocket filter.
exact_match: either or not filter source names by exact matching.

wadl:resource_type.wadl:doc: Branch merge proposals show intent of landing one branch on another.

wadl:doc.p: Set the specified person as a reviewer.
If they are not already a reviewer, a vote is created. Otherwise, the details are updated.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Return the CodeReviewComment with the specified ID.

wadl:doc.p: Update the preview diff for this proposal.
If there is not an existing preview diff, one will be created.

tr.td: The raw bytes of the diff content to be put in the librarian.
Text describing the files added, remove or modified.
The revision id that was used from the source branch.
The revision id that was used from the target branch.
The revision id that was used from the dependent branch.
Text describing the conflicts if any.

wadl:doc.p: Create an ICodeReviewComment associated with this merge proposal.

tr.td: The person who the message is from.
The subject line to use for the message.
The text to use for the message content. If unspecified, the text of the merge proposal is used.
The previous CodeReviewComment in the thread. If unspecified, the root message is used.

wadl:doc.p: Return true if the reviewer is able to review the proposal.

There is an attribute on branches called reviewer which allows a specific person or team to be set for a branch as an authorised person to approve merges for a branch. If a reviewer is not set on the target branch, then the owner of the target branch is used as the authorised user.

wadl:param.name: reviewer
wadl:param.wadl:doc: A person for which the reviewer status is in question.

wadl:param.wadl:doc: The value of the HTTP ETag for this resource.

wadl:doc.p: Queuer
The person that queued up the branch.
Source Branch
The branch that has code to land.
Status
The current state of the proposal.

wadl:param.name: all_comments_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All messages discussing this merge proposal

wadl:doc.p: Review person or team
The person that accepted (or rejected) the code for merging.
Person
The person who registered the landing target.
Target Branch
The branch that the source branch will be merged into.

wadl:param.name: preview_diff_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The current diff of the source branch against the target branch.

wadl:doc.p: Commit Message
The commit message that should be used when merging the source branch.
Supersedes
The branch merge proposal that this one supersedes.
Queue Position
The position in the queue.
Date Merged
The date that the source branch was merged into the target branch
The email address for this proposal.
Any emails sent to this address will resultin comments being added.
Queued Revision ID
The revision id that has been queued for landing.
Dependent Branch
The branch that the source branch branched from. If this is the same as the target branch, then leave this field blank.
Merged Revision Number
The revision number on the target branch which contains the merge from the source branch.
Superseded By
The branch merge proposal that supersedes this one.
Merge Reporter
The user that marked the branch as merged.
Commit Message
The commit message that should be used when merging the source branch.

wadl:doc.p: Notification Level

Attribute notifications are sent when branch details are changed such as lifecycle status and name. Revision notifications are generated when new branch revisions are found due to the branch being updated through either pushes to the hosted branches or the mirrored branches being updated.
Generated Diff Size Limit

Diffs greater than the specified number of lines will not be sent to the subscriber. The subscriber will still receive an email with the new revision details even if the diff is larger than the specified number of lines.
Code review Level
Control the kind of review activity that triggers notifications.
Person

Enter the launchpad id, or email address of the person you wish to subscribe to this branch. If you are unsure, use the "Choose..." option to find the person in Launchpad. You can only subscribe someone who is a registered user of the system.
Notification Level

Attribute notifications are sent when branch details are changed such as lifecycle status and name. Revision notifications are generated when new branch revisions are found due to the branch being updated through either pushes to the hosted branches or the mirrored branches being updated.
Generated Diff Size Limit

Diffs greater than the specified number of lines will not be sent to the subscriber. The subscriber will still receive an email with the new revision details even if the diff is larger than the specified number of lines.
Code review Level
Control the kind of review activity that triggers notifications.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Request that this branch be mirrored on the next run of the branch puller.

wadl:param.name: self_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The canonical link to this resource.

wadl:param.name: resource_type_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The link to the WADL description of this resource.

wadl:param.name: http_etag
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The value of the HTTP ETag for this resource.

wadl:doc.p: Unique name
Unique name of the branch, including the owner and project names.
Dependent Branches
A collection of the merge proposals that are dependent on this branch.
Owner
Either yourself or a team you are a member of. This controls who can modify the branch.
Default Review Team
The reviewer of a branch is the person or team that is responsible for reviewing proposals and merging into this branch.

wadl:param.name: registrant_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The user that registered the branch.

wadl:doc.p: Title
Describe the branch as clearly as possible in up to 70 characters. This title is displayed in every branch list or report.
Bazaar Identity

The bzr branch path as accessed by Launchpad. If the branch is associated with a product as the primary development focus, then the result should be lp:product. If the branch is related to a series, then lp:product/series. Otherwise the result is lp:~user/product/branch-name.
Project
The project this branch belongs to.

wadl:param.name: mirror_status_message
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The last message we got when mirroring this branch.

wadl:doc.p: Display name
The branch title if provided, or the unique_name.
Landing Candidates
A collection of the merge proposals where this branch is the target branch.
Landing Targets
A collection of the merge proposals where this branch is the source branch.

wadl:option.value: Bazaar pack repository format 1 with subtree support (needs bzr 0.92)
Bazaar pack repository format 1 with rich root (needs bzr 1.0)
Bazaar development format 0 (needs bzr.dev from before 1.3)
Bazaar development format 0 with subtree support (needs bzr.dev from before 1.3)
Bazaar development format 1 (needs bzr.dev from before 1.6)
Bazaar development format 1 with subtree support (needs bzr.dev from before 1.6)
Bazaar development format 2 (needs bzr.dev from before 1.8)
Bazaar development format 2 with subtree support (needs bzr.dev from before 1.8)

wadl:doc.p: Name
Keep very short, unique, and descriptive, because it will be used in URLs. Examples: main, devel, release-1.0, gnome-vfs.
Branch URL
This is the external location where the Bazaar branch is hosted.
Whiteboard
Notes on the current status of the branch.
Summary
A single-paragraph description of the branch. This will be displayed on the branch page.
Owner
Either yourself or a team you are a member of. This controls who can modify the branch.
Default Review Team
The reviewer of a branch is the person or team that is responsible for reviewing proposals and merging into this branch.
Title
Describe the branch as clearly as possible in up to 70 characters. This title is displayed in every branch list or report.
Project
The project this branch belongs to.

Keep very short, unique, and descriptive, because it will be used in URLs. Examples: main, devel, release-1.0, gnome-vfs.

This is the external location where the Bazaar branch is hosted.

Notes on the current status of the branch.

wadl:doc.p: The vendor ID
Allowed values of the vendor ID depend on the bus of the device.

Vendor IDs of PCI, PCCard and USB devices are hexadecimal string representations of 16 bit integers in the format '0x01ab': The prefix '0x', followed by exactly 4 digits; where a digit is one of the characters 0..9, a..f. The characters A..F are not allowed.
SCSI vendor IDs are strings with exactly 8 characters. Shorter names are right-padded with space (0x20) characters.
IDs for other buses may be arbitrary strings.
The product ID
Allowed values of the product ID depend on the bus of the device.

Product IDs of PCI, PCCard and USB devices are hexadecimal string representations of 16 bit integers in the format '0x01ab': The prefix '0x', followed by exactly 4 digits; where a digit is one of the characters 0..9, a..f. The characters A..F are not allowed.
SCSI product IDs are strings with exactly 16 characters. Shorter names are right-padded with space (0x20) characters.
IDs for other buses may be arbitrary strings.

Add the given person as a member of this team.
If the given person is already a member of this team we'll simply change its membership status. Otherwise a new TeamMembership is created with the given status.
If the person is actually a team and force_team_add is False, the team will actually be invited to join this one. Otherwise the team is added as if it were a person.

If the the person is not a team, and may_subscribe_to_list is True, then the person may be subscribed to the team's mailing list, depending on the list status and the person's auto-subscribe settings.
The given status must be either Approved, Proposed or Admin.
The reviewer is the user who made the given person a member of this team.
Join the given team if its subscriptionpolicy is not RESTRICTED.
Join the given team according to the policies and defaults of that team:

ul.li: If the team subscriptionpolicy is OPEN, the user is added as an APPROVED member with a NULL TeamMembership.reviewer.
If the team subscriptionpolicy is MODERATED, the user is added as a PROPOSED member and one of the team's administrators have to approve the membership.

wadl:doc.p: If may_subscribe_to_list is True, then also attempt to subscribe to the team's mailing list, depending on the list status and the person's auto-subscribe settings.

tr.td: The person who requested the membership on behalf of a team or None when a person requests the membership for himself.
If True, also try subscribing to the team mailing list.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Specify the location and time zone of a person.

wadl:param.name: time_zone
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The time zone of this object.

wadl:doc.p: Leave the given team.
If there's a membership entry for this person on the given team and its status is either APPROVED or ADMIN, we change the status to DEACTIVATED and remove the relevant entries in teamparticipation.

Teams cannot call this method because they're not allowed to login and thus can't 'leave' another team. Instead, they have their subscription deactivated (using the setMembershipData() method) by a team administrator.
Decline an invitation to become a member of the given team.
There must be a TeamMembership for this person and the given team with the INVITED status. The status of this TeamMembership will be changed to INVITATION_DECLINED.
Accept an invitation to become a member of the given team.
There must be a TeamMembership for this person and the given team with the INVITED status. The status of this TeamMembership will be changed to APPROVED.
Return the people whose membership on this team match :status:.
If no orderby is provided, Person.sortingColumns is used.

wadl:method.wadl:doc: Specify the visibility of a person's location and time zone.

wadl:doc.p: All subteams of this team.
A subteam is any team that is a member (either directly or indirectly) of this team. As an example, let's say we have this hierarchy of teams:

dl.dt: Rosetta Translators
Rosetta pt Translators
dl.dd: Rosetta pt_BR Translators

wadl:doc.p: In this case, both 'Rosetta pt Translators' and 'Rosetta pt_BR Translators' are subteams of the 'Rosetta Translators' team, and all members of both subteams are considered members of "Rosetta Translators".
Active TeamMemberships for this object's members.
Active TeamMemberships are the ones with the ADMIN or APPROVED status. The results are ordered using Person.sortingColumns.

wadl:param.name: memberships_details_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All TeamMemberships for Teams this Person is an active member of.

wadl:doc.p: Preferred email address
The preferred email address for this person. The one we'll use to communicate with them.
Confirmed e-mails of this person.
Confirmed e-mails are the ones in the VALIDATED state
All participants of this team.

List of all direct and indirect people and teams who, one way or another, are a part of this team. If you want a method to check if a given person is a member of a team, you should probably look at IPerson.inTeam().
Open membership invitations.
All TeamMemberships which represent an invitation (to join a team) sent to this person.
Personal Package Archive
The Archive owned by this person, his PPA.

wadl:param.name: languages_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: List of languages known by this person

wadl:param.name: proposed_members_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All members whose membership is in the PROPOSED state

wadl:doc.p: All superteams of this team.
A superteam is any team that this team is a member of. For example, let's say we have this hierarchy of teams, and we are the "Rosetta pt_BR Translators":

dl.dt: Rosetta Translators
Rosetta pt Translators
dl.dd: Rosetta pt_BR Translators

wadl:doc.p: In this case, we will return both 'Rosetta pt Translators' and 'Rosetta Translators', because we are member of both of them.

An object for searching across projects, project groups, and distros.

Projects, project groups, and distributions are collectively known as "pillars". This object lets you do a combined search across all types of pillars. It also gives you access to pillars that have been flagged by administrators as "featured" pillars.
Return Projects/Project groups/Distros matching :text:.
If :limit: is None, the default batch size will be used.
The results are ordered descending by rank.

wadl:param.wadl:doc: Maximum number of items to return. This is a hard limit: any pagination you request will happen within this limit.

The given status must be different than the current status.

wadl:doc.p: Date joined
The date in which this membership was made active for the first time.
ITeam extends IPerson.
The teamowner should never be None.
Add the given person as a member of this team.
If the given person is already a member of this team we'll simply change its membership status. Otherwise a new TeamMembership is created with the given status.
If the person is actually a team and force_team_add is False, the team will actually be invited to join this one. Otherwise the team is added as if it were a person.

If the the person is not a team, and may_subscribe_to_list is True, then the person may be subscribed to the team's mailing list, depending on the list status and the person's auto-subscribe settings.
The given status must be either Approved, Proposed or Admin.
The reviewer is the user who made the given person a member of this team.
Join the given team if its subscriptionpolicy is not RESTRICTED.
Join the given team according to the policies and defaults of that team:

ul.li: If the team subscriptionpolicy is OPEN, the user is added as an APPROVED member with a NULL TeamMembership.reviewer.
If the team subscriptionpolicy is MODERATED, the user is added as a PROPOSED member and one of the team's administrators have to approve the membership.

wadl:doc.p: If may_subscribe_to_list is True, then also attempt to subscribe to the team's mailing list, depending on the list status and the person's auto-subscribe settings.

tr.td: The person who requested the membership on behalf of a team or None when a person requests the membership for himself.
If True, also try subscribing to the team mailing list.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Specify the location and time zone of a person.

wadl:param.name: time_zone
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The time zone of this object.

wadl:doc.p: Leave the given team.
If there's a membership entry for this person on the given team and its status is either APPROVED or ADMIN, we change the status to DEACTIVATED and remove the relevant entries in teamparticipation.

Teams cannot call this method because they're not allowed to login and thus can't 'leave' another team. Instead, they have their subscription deactivated (using the setMembershipData() method) by a team administrator.
Decline an invitation to become a member of the given team.
There must be a TeamMembership for this person and the given team with the INVITED status. The status of this TeamMembership will be changed to INVITATION_DECLINED.
Accept an invitation to become a member of the given team.
There must be a TeamMembership for this person and the given team with the INVITED status. The status of this TeamMembership will be changed to APPROVED.
Return the people whose membership on this team match :status:.
If no orderby is provided, Person.sortingColumns is used.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Specify the visibility of a person's location and time zone.

wadl:param.name: self_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The canonical link to this resource.

wadl:param.name: resource_type_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The link to the WADL description of this resource.

wadl:param.name: http_etag
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The value of the HTTP ETag for this resource.

wadl:param.name: expired_members_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All members whose membership is in the EXPIRED state

wadl:param.name: invited_members_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All members whose membership is in the INVITED state

wadl:param.name: irc_nicknames_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: List of IRC nicknames of this Person.

wadl:doc.p: All subteams of this team.
A subteam is any team that is a member (either directly or indirectly) of this team. As an example, let's say we have this hierarchy of teams:

dl.dt: Rosetta Translators
Rosetta pt Translators
dl.dd: Rosetta pt_BR Translators

wadl:doc.p: In this case, both 'Rosetta pt Translators' and 'Rosetta pt_BR Translators' are subteams of the 'Rosetta Translators' team, and all members of both subteams are considered members of "Rosetta Translators".
Subscription period
Number of days a new subscription lasts before expiring. You can customize the length of an individual subscription when approving it. Leave this empty or set to 0 for subscriptions to never expire.
Renewal period
Number of days a subscription lasts after being renewed. You can customize the lengths of individual renewals, but this is what's used for auto-renewed and user-renewed memberships.
Active TeamMemberships for this object's members.
Active TeamMemberships are the ones with the ADMIN or APPROVED status. The results are ordered using Person.sortingColumns.

wadl:param.name: memberships_details_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All TeamMemberships for Teams this Person is an active member of.

wadl:doc.p: Personal Package Archive
The Archive owned by this person, his PPA.
Team Description
Use plain text; URLs will be linkified
Preferred email address
The preferred email address for this person. The one we'll use to communicate with them.
Confirmed e-mails of this person.
Confirmed e-mails are the ones in the VALIDATED state
All participants of this team.

List of all direct and indirect people and teams who, one way or another, are a part of this team. If you want a method to check if a given person is a member of a team, you should probably look at IPerson.inTeam().
Open membership invitations.
All TeamMemberships which represent an invitation (to join a team) sent to this person.

wadl:param.name: languages_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: List of languages known by this person

wadl:param.name: proposed_members_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All members whose membership is in the PROPOSED state

wadl:doc.p: Subscription policy
'Moderated' means all subscriptions must be approved. 'Open' means any user can join without approval. 'Restricted' means new members can be added only by a team administrator.
All superteams of this team.
A superteam is any team that this team is a member of. For example, let's say we have this hierarchy of teams, and we are the "Rosetta pt_BR Translators":

dl.dt: Rosetta Translators
Rosetta pt Translators
dl.dd: Rosetta pt_BR Translators

wadl:doc.p: In this case, we will return both 'Rosetta pt Translators' and 'Rosetta Translators', because we are member of both of them.
Mailing List Auto-subscription Policy
This attribute determines whether a person is automatically subscribed to a team's mailing list when the person joins said team.

wadl:option.value: Ask me when I join a team
Always subscribe me to mailing lists

wadl:param.name: deactivated_members_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All members whose membership is in the DEACTIVATED state

wadl:param.name: wiki_names_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: All WikiNames of this Person, sorted alphabetically by URL.

wadl:doc.p: Display Name
Your name as you would like it displayed throughout Launchpad. Most people use their full name here.

wadl:param.name: hide_email_addresses
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Hide my email addresses from other Launchpad users

wadl:param.name: jabber_ids_collection_link
wadl:param.wadl:doc: List of Jabber IDs of this Person.

wadl:doc.p: Karma
The cached total karma for this person.
Visibility
Public visibility is standard, and Private Membership means that a team's members are hidden.
Mugshot

A large image of exactly 192x192 pixels, that will be displayed on your home page in Launchpad. Traditionally this is a great big picture of your grinning face. Make the most of it! It should be no bigger than 100kb in size.

wadl:param.name: is_valid
wadl:param.wadl:doc: This is an active user or a team.

wadl:doc.p: Homepage Content
The content of your home page. Edit this and it will be displayed for all the world to see.
Name
A short unique name, beginning with a lower-case letter or number, and containing only letters, numbers, dots, hyphens, or plus signs.

renew their membership automatically, also notifying the admins
